intro: Salsola glomerata, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia and North Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is highly drought-tolerant and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces a large number of seeds that are easily dispersed by wind, contributing to its invasive potential in new regions. Salsola glomerata is often found in disturbed soils and can form dense stands, impacting native vegetation.
